concept.title: JDBC Consumer
concept.shortdesc: The JDBC Consumer origin uses a JDBC connection to read database data. JDBC Consumer returns data as a map with column names and field values.

conbody.p: originsJDBC ConsumerJDBC Consumer originoverviewWhen you configure JDBC Consumer, you specify connection information, query interval, and custom JDBC configuration properties to determine how the origin connects to the database. You configure the query mode, offset column, initial offset value, and SQL query to define the data returned by the database.

You can configure the JDBC Consumer to perform change data capture for databases that store the information in a table. You can configure the origin to add JDBC namespace header attributes. You can also configure custom properties that your driver requires.
To use a JDBC version older than 4.0, you can specify the driver class name and define a health check query.
